Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: Among the following forest types in India, which one occupies the largest area?
Indian Geography.explanation: The Moist deciduous forests are more pronounced in the regions which record rainfall between 100-200cm. These forests are found in the northeastern states along the foothills of Himalayas, easteren slopes of the Western Ghats and Odisha. Tropical moist deciduous forest covers arounds 37% of the total cover in India which is the largest occupied area among 16 different forest types of the country.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: The National Forestry Action Plan aims to bring 33% of land area in India under tree cover by which year?
Indian Geography.explanation: The National Forestry Action Plan aims to bring 33% of land area in India under tree cover by 2012.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: The reservoir GB Pant Sagar is located on which river?
Indian Geography.explanation: Govind Ballabh Pant Sagar is on the Rihand River which is the tributary of the Son River.

Indian Geography.subject: Indian Geography
Indian Geography.question: Which one of the following national parks is located near Chamoli?
Indian Geography.explanation: The Nanda Devi National Park is a national park situated around the peak of Nanda Devi (7,816 m). It is situated in Chamoli district, Uttarakhand.

World Geography.subject: World Geography
World Geography.question: Which one of the following cities is located on the banks of the River St Lawrence?
World Geography.explanation: Montreal is Situated on the bank of river st. lowrence.
